div.div:
Adult Education classes will open as soon as we receive permission from the Utah Department of Health. We will accept applications for new students and volunteers as soon as we are open. Thank you for your patience. We hope to see you soon!
Las clases para adultos se abrirán en cuanto tengamos permiso del Departamento de Salubridad. Empezaremos a recibir solicitudes de nuevos estudiantes y voluntarios en cuanto volvamos a abrir. Gracias por su paciencia. ¡Esperamos verlos pronto!

​By order of Governor Gary Herbert and Utah State Superintendent of Schools Sydnee Dickson, K-12 schools are to remain closed until at least May 1, 2020. This affects all children’s programs here at Guadalupe School. In an effort to provide what services we can to our families, the following measures will be taken during this time:
Meals will continue to be provided as they have been these past weeks. Meals will be delivered to the Green, Orange and Purple bus routes; buses leave the school around 9:30 each day. All other families can pick up meals for their students at the school beginning at 9:00 a.m. each day.
Schoolwork packets for K-6 Charter School will be delivered with meals on Mondays. Please return the packet to the school the following Friday either by bringing it in or sending it with the bus driver. Teachers will be reviewing and correcting student work and adjusting learning plans as necessary.
Schoolwork for Toddler Beginnings and Preschool students for the weeks of March 30 and April 6 have been sent by U.S. mail. They should be arriving this week.
Teachers will be in touch with students regularly by phone. If your student has access to a video conferencing program such as Zoom, Skype, FaceTime, etc., please let the teacher know. As things change, as new information becomes available, we will post notices on both our website and Facebook page. Keep checking back here. Wash your hands. Stay well.
Por orden del Gobernador Gary Herbert y Superintendente de Escuelas del Estado de Utah Sydnee Dickson, todas las escuelas K-12 permanecerán cerradas hasta el 1 de mayo del 2020. Esta decisión se aplica a todos los programas para niños aquí en la Escuela Guadalupe. Con la intención de seguir brindando los servicios que podamos a nuestras familias, se tomarán las siguientes medidas durante este tiempo:
Seguiremos entregando comidas igual que las últimas semanas. Para familias de las rutas de autobuses Verde, Anaranjada y Púrpura, se entregarán comidas a las paradas o a domicilio. Los autobuses saldarán de la escuela a las 9:30 de lunes a viernes. Adicionalmente, se entregarán comidas en la escuela a partir de las 9:00 de lunes a viernes.
Para estudiantes de la Escuela Chárter (K-6), se entregarán paquetes de tareas escolares cada lunes junto con la comida. Favor de devolver el paquete completado el siguiente viernes, ya sea en persona o con el conductor del autobús. Los maestros revisarán las tareas y harán ajustes a los planes de aprendizaje como sea necesario.
Para estudiantes de Comienzos Infantiles y Preescolar, se enviarán paquetes de tareas escolares por correo. Estos paquetes cubrirán las dos semanas del 30 de marzo y el 6 de abril. Los paquetes deben llegar al domicilio en el trascurso de esta semana.
Los maestros se comunicarán con los alumnos con frecuencia. Si su estudiante tiene acceso a algún programa de videoconferencia tipo Skype, Zoom, FaceTime, etc., favor de avisarle al maestro. A la medida que la situación cambia y tengamos nueva información, publicaremos actualizaciones tanto en nuestro sitio web como en la página de Facebook. Siguen revisando aquí. Lávense las manos. Cuídense mucho.

Tuesday, March 17, 2020
We have created a new page on our website where we will be sharing updates on the COVID-19 situation including school closure information, schoolwork packets, distance learning, and meal service. Please see our COVID-19 link at the top of this page.
Hemos creado un nuevo elemento de este sitio web en donde compartiremos actualizaciones en cuanto al virus COVID-19 incluyendo la clausura de la escuela, paquetes de tareas escolares, enseñanza a distancia, y servicios de nutrición. Favor de ver en enlace COVID-19 en el menú ubicado en la parte superior de esta página.

Usted puede acudir a los siguientes sitios web para mayores informes:
You can visit the following websites for more information about COVID-19:
State Board of Education’s informational website on COVID-19: https://schools.utah.gov/coronavirus
State of Utah website: https://coronavirus.utah.gov/
Salt Lake County Health Department website: https://slco.org/health/COVID-19/ Centers for Disease Control website: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html

h2.font: Hit play to see how Guadalupe School is transforming lives through education.

strong.font: Guadalupe School is a nonprofit organization consisting of five academic programs that transform lives through education. Our In-Home program, Toddler Beginnings program, Preschool, Charter School, and Adult Education program provide the educational tools and resources needed to succeed while ​moving towards ​higher education and job preparedness.
Learning about Guadalupe School straight from current students and their families! Click play on the videos below.

"During my five years at Guadalupe, ​I have not only improved my teaching skills, but I have grown as a human being and made good friends."
-

"I give what little I can because I believe in the principles Guadalupe was founded on. When it comes to the newest members of our community what better way to welcome them than by opening the door to education
"When I started coming to Guadalupe School I was really shy,but every tutor that taught me English lessons gave me the confidence to keep learning and speaking English.

font.br: Guadalupe School is a licensed 501(c)3 Nonprofit
